docstr: `INT2` â€” Convert to 16-bit integer type ### Description Convert to a `KIND=2` integer type. This is equivalent to the standard `INT` intrinsic with an optional argument of `KIND=2`, and is only included for backwards compatibility. The `SHORT` intrinsic is equivalent to `INT2`. ### Syntax `RESULT = INT2(A)` ### Arguments , `REAL`, or `COMPLEX`. ### Return value The return value is a `INTEGER(2)` variable. ### Standard GNU extension ### Class Elemental function ### See also INT, INT8, LONG
